benchmark_details.name: ACETADA (A Comprehensive Evaluation of Nutrition via Advanced Dietary Assessment)
benchmark_details.overview: This study introduces ACETADA, the first publicly available food-image dataset that pairs dietitian-verified nutrition labels with GPS coordinates, timestamps, and ground-truth food lists.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The goal is to provide an open dataset to improve nutrition analysis through the integration of contextual metadata with meal images.

data.source: ACETADA dietary study conducted with 152 adults to collect meal images and nutrition data.

methodology.calculation: MAE is calculated as the average of absolute deviations from dietitian-verified values.
methodology.interpretation: Lower MAE and MAPE indicate improved accuracy in estimating nutritional values.
methodology.validation: Empirical results show integration of contextual metadata reduces MAE and MAPE.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The dataset includes demographic information about participants.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Consent was obtained from participants in the dietary study.
